page.title: 01BERNERA:Tobson.
page.content: About half of this block is sea. The coast is rocky and broken. The land is rough undulating moorland with rock often showing through. Three sea lochs penetrate the land from the west; the longest, Tob Valasay, runs 2 km. north from the combined inlet. The crofting township of Tobson, comprising twenty-four crofts, is situated at the head of Tob Valasay. Four of the crofts are on the tip of the peninsula enclosing Tob Valasay and are accessible by footbridge. There are several small fresh water lochs in this block.
